Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    A simulated database class that allows multiple readers and a single writer to access the data.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> data  
      private int howManyReaders  
      private int maxReaders  
      private boolean writer  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Database​(int maxNumOfReaders)
      Constructs a new Database instance with the specified maximum number of readers.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String get​(java.lang.String key)
      Retrieves the value associated with the specified key from the database.
      void put​(java.lang.String key, java.lang.String value)
      Puts the specified key-value pair into the database.
      void readAcquire​()
      Acquires a read lock on the database.
      void readRelease​()
      Releases the read lock on the database.
      boolean readTryAcquire​()
      Tries to acquire a read lock on the database.

      Acquires a write lock on the database.
      void writeRelease​()
      Releases the write lock on the database.

    • Field Detail

      • data

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> data

      • howManyReaders

        private int howManyReaders

      • maxReaders

        private int maxReaders

        private boolean writer

    • Constructor Detail

      • Database

        public Database​(int maxNumOfReaders)
        Constructs a new Database instance with the specified maximum number of readers.
        Parameters:
        maxNumOfReaders - The maximum number of readers allowed to access the database concurrently.

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public void put​(java.lang.String key,
                java.lang.String value)
        Puts the specified key-value pair into the database.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to be inserted.
        value - The value to be associated with the key.

      • get

        public java.lang.String get​(java.lang.String key)
        Retrieves the value associated with the specified key from the database.
        Parameters:
        key - The key whose associated value is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        The value associated with the key, or null if the key is not found.

      • readTryAcquire

        public boolean readTryAcquire​()
        Tries to acquire a read lock on the database. This method allows a thread to check if it can acquire a read lock without blocking.
        Returns:
        true if the read lock is acquired, false otherwise.

      • readAcquire

        public void readAcquire​()
        Acquires a read lock on the database. This method blocks the calling thread until it can acquire the read lock.

      • readRelease

        public void readRelease​()
        Releases the read lock on the database. This method must be called by a thread that previously acquired the read lock. It notifies waiting threads if there are no more readers.

      • writeAcquire

        public void writeAcquire​()
        Acquires a write lock on the database. This method blocks the calling thread until it can acquire the write lock.

      • writeTryAcquire

        public boolean writeTryAcquire​()
        Tries to acquire a write lock on the database. This method allows a thread to check if it can acquire a write lock without blocking.
        Returns:
        true if the write lock is acquired, false otherwise.

      • writeRelease

        public void writeRelease​()
        Releases the write lock on the database. This method must be called by a thread that previously acquired the write lock. It notifies waiting threads that the writer has released the lock.
